paragraphs.text: The dawn of Kim Jong-un's rule.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: It has been a few years since the sudden death of the Sun of the Nation, Marshal Kim Jong-il which made his third son, Kim Jong-un, then in his late 20s, the supreme leader of North Korea
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Three years is the length of the traditional mourning period that Koreans are supposed to observe after the death of their father or sovereign
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Thus
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: now is the time to make some observations about Kim's North Korea
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What has remained the same, and what has changed since December 2011?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The dawn of Kim's rule was marked by intense purges of his father's top dignitaries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In December 2011, during his father's funeral, Kim walked next to his father's hearse in the company of three top generals and four top civilian officials
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Three years on, none of these people have their jobs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At least one of them was executed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: while all but one have disappeared without a trace
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Kim's decision to arrest and execute Chang Song-taek, his aunt's husband, long the "grey eminence" of Pyongyang politics, was a dramatic signal to the elite
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The sorry fate of Chang was meant to show that nobody is immune from the wrath of the supreme leader
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: These purges were obviously necessary to start changing the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: since Kim's policies will be very different from those of his father and grandfather
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So far, the most important changes can be seen in the field of economic management
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From late 2012, the North Korean government began to implement reforms which are remarkably similar to what China did in the early days of Deng Xiaoping, around 1980
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Farmers, who were hitherto government employees with a fixed salary, are now given a certain percentage of the harvest, and have predictably started to feel motivated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a result, the food situation has improved markedly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In industry, a slow-motion switch from a Leninist, centrally planned economy to markets has been initiated as well
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The unofficial private economy, far more advanced in North Korea than most imagine, is now quietly encouraged
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no sign of relaxation in the political sphere, however
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Kim has launched a massive crackdown on illegal border movements, effectively closing North Korea's border with China
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which had remained porous for decades
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He has also done much to root out the penchant that many North Koreans have recently developed for smuggled foreign TV shows, especially South Korean soap operas and films
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such concerns are not merely motivated by paranoia, regardless of what the international media says
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The supreme leader knows that his position is precarious, and that tightening the screws of social control and surveillance may help him prolong his rule
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: North Korea under Kim remains as stubborn in its nuclear ambitions as it was under his father
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Having seen the US invasions of Iraq and Afghanistan, as well as the popular rebellion against Libya's Gaddafi that was indirectly assisted by western might, North Korean decision-makers have every reason to want to continue to advance their nuclear weapons potential
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the same time
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there has also been a truly unprecedented crisis in Sino- North Korean relations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the last years of Kim Jong-il, China was North Korea's major sponsor and trade partner
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Now things are different
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Chinese and North Korean media (strictly controlled by the government in both countries) have exchanged thinly veiled verbal attacks
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while the Chinese government has frozen all Beijing-sponsored infrastructure projects in North Korea - including, for example, a new bridge over the Yalu River
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The North Korean government under Kim has shown hitherto unprecedented interest in foreign investment, as long as this investment comes from sources other than China
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At present, the young marshal has pinned his hopes on Russia - currently itself on a collision course with the West
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: North Korean leaders obviously believe that Russia under Vladimir Putin will behave like the Soviet Union once did and shower North Korea with aid grants as a reward for Pyongyang's militant anti-Americanism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such hopes are misplaced
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it will take some time before Pyongyang's decision-makers realise the sad truth
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is little doubt that Kim wants to be popular and loved by his people, and perhaps sincerely cares about the wellbeing of the North Korean populace
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: though he might have rather eccentric ideas on what constitutes such wellbeing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Under his watch, the North Korean government has spent a significant part of its meagre resources on building all kinds of entertainment facilities, including an elite ski resort, a number of water parks and even a dolphinarium
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Kim's North Korea is increasingly a place quite different from the North Korea of his father
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is moving towards a more efficient economy, but also towards more internal repression
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is more prone to erratic changes in domestic policy and more eccentric in many regards
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: of course
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for the foreseeable future it is going to remain a nuclear and authoritarian regime, run by the Kim family and a small hereditary elite
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is not negotiable, irrespectively of what the outside world thinks and does
paragraphs.label: assumption
